page.title: 05 Reliant Motor Cars.
page.content: At the bottom of Basin Lane stands the Reliant factory which was built fifty years ago in 1935. They do not make the whole car in Basin Lane just the {fibre glass bodies}. The main factory is on the Watling Street between Two Gates and Fazeley. Five hundred people work for Reliant one hundred and fifty work at Basin Lane. {The cars} Reliant make are the Rialto costing three thousand pounds, the Scimiar twelve thousand pounds, the Fox and the new SS1. As well as making car bodies the factory produces battery cases, moulds for taxi bodies and walkways for chemical factories. They produce eight cars a day. The car bodies are made of fibre glass and resin. They use hot presses which reach 150 degrees Celsius.
